definitions.text: move while supporting, either in a vehicle or in one's hands or on one's body
examples: You must carry your camping gear
carry the suitcases to the car
This train is carrying nuclear waste
These pipes carry waste water into the river

definitions.text: have with oneself; have on one's person
examples: She always takes an umbrella
I always carry money
She packs a gun when she goes into the mountains

definitions.text: transmit or serve as the medium for transmission
examples: Sound carries well over water
The airwaves carry the sound
Many metals conduct heat

definitions.text: serve as a means for expressing something
examples: The painting of Mary carries motherly love
His voice carried a lot of anger

definitions.text: bear or be able to bear the weight, pressure,or responsibility of
examples: His efforts carried the entire project
How many credits is this student carrying?
We carry a very large mortgage

definitions.text: support or hold in a certain manner
examples: She holds her head high
He carried himself upright
The jar carries wine
The canteen holds fresh water
This can contains water
carry too far
She carries her ideas to the extreme
The civil war carried into the neighboring province
The disease extended into the remote mountain provinces

definitions.text: be necessarily associated with or result in or involve
examples: This crime carries a penalty of five years in prison
The senator carried his home state
How many people are carried on the payroll?
She carried herself well
he bore himself with dignity
They conducted themselves well during these difficult times
Do you carry kerosene heaters?

definitions.text: include as the content; broadcast or publicize
examples: We ran the ad three times
This paper carries a restaurant review
All major networks carried the press conference
Carry the ball
dribble the ball
The news was carried to every village in the province

definitions.text: have as an inherent or characteristic feature or have as a consequence
examples: This new washer carries a two year guarantee
The loan carries a high interest rate
this undertaking carries many dangers
She carries her mother's genes
These bonds carry warrants
The restaurant carries an unusual name

definitions.text: be conveyed over a certain distance
examples: Her voice carries very well in this big opera house
The Federal Government carried the province for many years
I carry her image in my mind's eye
I will carry the secret to my grave
I carry these thoughts in the back of my head
I carry a lot of life insurance

definitions.text: be equipped with (a mast or sail)
examples: This boat can only carry a small sail
Carry all before one
His speech did not sway the voters

definitions.text: compensate for a weaker partner or member by one's own performance
examples: I resent having to carry her all the time
carry a cause

definitions.text: have on the surface or on the skin
examples: carry scars
The troops carried the town after a brief fight

definitions.text: transfer (entries) from one account book to another
transfer (a number, cipher, or remainder) to the next column or unit's place before or after, in addition or multiplication
examples: put down 5 and carry 2

definitions.text: pursue a line of scent or be a bearer
examples: the dog was taught to fetch and carry
this land does not carry olives
The sudden gust of air propelled the ball to the other side of the fence

definitions.text: drink alcohol without showing ill effects
examples: He can hold his liquor
he had drunk more than he could carry
This land will carry ten cows to the acre
This rifle carries for 3,000 feet

definitions.text: cover a certain distance or advance beyond
examples: The drive carried to the green

definitions.text: secure the passage or adoption (of bills and motions)
examples: The motion carried easily
She lost the game but carried the match

definitions.text: sing or play against other voices or parts
examples: He cannot carry a tune
She is bearing his child
The are expecting another child in January
I am carrying his child
synonyms: have a bun in the oven
